incidents.name: IOT Network Issues in Africa Due to Fiber-Cut

incident_updates.body: Connectivity issues in Africa have significantly improved for impacted countries. At this time we are observing metrics consistent to those prior to the outage. The issue is now considered resolved.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS, Middle East & Africa
INTERNET OF THINGS - Programmable Wireless
INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body:
Connectivity issues in Africa have significantly improved for impacted countries. At this time we are observing metrics consistent to those prior to the outage. Please not that there is still reduced capacity on the continent for some countries and this could present itself as increase latency and lower throughput until the issue is fully resolved by the network operators. 

We will continue to monitor and will provide an update within 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS, Middle East & Africa
INTERNET OF THINGS - Programmable Wireless
INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: Due to issues with multiple underwater cables that handle connectivity to Africa, connectivity for cellular IoT products, Super SIM and Programmable Wireless, in the region may be severely impacted up to being completely down. Impact and recovery time across networks and countries may vary significantly. Repairs to the cable could take considerable time and service may not return to normal until complete. We will continue to monitor and will provide an update within 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Issue with Twilio helper libraries

incident_updates.body: We have patched the fix in latest version of the affected libraries. This incident has been resolved. To ensure the stability and optimal performance, we highly recommend upgrading to the latest versions of our helper libraries

affected_components.name: DEVELOPER TOOLS - REST API

incident_updates.body: We have patched the fix in the latest version of the affected libraries. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. To ensure the stability and optimal performance, we highly recommend upgrading to the latest versions of our helper libraries.

affected_components.name: DEVELOPER TOOLS - REST API

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have identified the root cause and partially fixed three (Node, Java, and c#) helper libraries. Our engineering team is actively working to release new versions of Python and Go helpers as well. We recommend upgrading to latest versions for the fixed libraries. We expect to provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: DEVELOPER TOOLS - REST API

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have identified the issue with Twilio helper libraries and are working to deploy a fix. Current workaround is using go: v1.19.0 https://github.com/twilio/twilio-go/releases/tag/v1.19.0, node: 4.23.0 https://www.npmjs.com/package/twilio/v/4.23.0, python: 8.13.0, java: 9.16.0 https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.twilio.sdk/twilio/9.16.0, c#: 6.18.0 https://www.nuget.org/packages/Twilio/6.18.0. We expect to provide another update in 24 hours as engineering will be fixing the issue in the next release.

affected_components.name: DEVELOPER TOOLS - REST API

incident_updates.body: Engineers continue to investigate a service interruption with Python helper library release 9.0.0.  Customers can't use the latest version of the helper library for certain requests. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: DEVELOPER TOOLS - REST API

incident_updates.body: We are investigating a service interruption with Python helper library release 9.0.0.  Customers can't use the latest version of the helper library for certain requests. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
